chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M. Henchey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

1 DNA sample w/ surcharges in all cases except 15CM659.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: No consumption or possession of controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.   

AODA and follow up.  

Payment of any oustanding court ordered financial obligations.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  2:33 p.m. 
INCLUDES 15CF599, 15CF664 and 15CF904.
State appears by ADA Patrick McMenamin via zoom video. Defendant appears in custody at MCJ with Atty Joseph Kaupie via zoom video. 
Date and time set for hearing on sentencing after revocation on all files. 
ADA McMenamin makes statement. 
Atty Kaupie makes arguments. 
Defendant makes statement.  
COURT grants revocation.  

15CF599>>
COURT orders on Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater); 3 years prison (1 year IC/2 years ES); concurrent with each other.  COURT grants 178 days credit. 

15CF664>>
COURT orders on Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater); 3 years prison (1 year IC/2 years ES) and Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); 5 years prison (2 years IC/3 years ES); concurrent with each other.  COURT grants 175 days credit. 

15CF904>>
COURT orders on Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); 5 years prison (2 years IC/3 years ES); concurrent with each other.  COURT grants 534 days credit. 

CONDITIONS of all cases:  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  No consumption or possession of controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.  AODA and follow up.  Payment of any oustanding court ordered financial obligations.  COURT finds defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.  

Adj:  3:06 p.m.
